revised_title: Magnetization Effects on the Length of Iron, Steel, and Nickel Rods
tldr: The author investigates the effects of magnetization on the length of iron, steel, and nickel rods, discovering that magnetization causes elongation in iron and steel rods and retraction in nickel rods. The study also reveals that the critical point for magnetization depends on the hardness of the steel and that stretching affects the value of the critical magnetizing force in iron rods.
